item.title: IHG will no longer provide mini toiletries as bathroom amenities
item.description:
Source: IHG. A shower with sink showing miniatures as amenities. The InterContinental Hotels Group (IHG) is transitioning from small, individual toiletry bottles to larger, bulk amenity dispensers in all 843,000 rooms across its portfolio of hotels. This change, to be fully implemented by 2021, is part of a larger sustainability initiative and establishes IHG as the first global hotel company to entirely eliminate miniature bathroom products in favor of bulk-sized options...
